comment.author: 13935339@N05
comment._content:
P-400 (export variant of the P-39) RAF serial AP375, possibly assigned to the 41st Fighter Squadron, 35th FG.

According the Edwards Park in his book, NANETTE:
"The ops officer looked up from where he was sitting. 'The flights are just being posted,' he said. Mostly it will be the same setup as today except for Park. I just found out that 74's losing oil ("Nanette" - ed.), so you'll get another ship. Nailor, you'll fly in Yellow flight...' And so on. I moved over to the bulletin board and found my name with '75' beside it. I knew perfectly well what caused Nanette's oil leak. Cowardice.

"Number 75 had been assigned to me before. A P-400, that export model which the RAF had wisely turned down..."

Park tangled with an enemy bomber, and Number 75 - the nose art appears to read "ONE FOR THE ROAD," after the popular song - was badly holed for his efforts. So badly that it was scrapped and cannibalized...
